description: The trail leads northward, though overgrown trees and shrubbery.
Branches hang across the path and brush against your face as you walk.
It doesn't look like this trail has been used in awhile, parts of it
are barely recognizable.
52301.name: A Small Trail

description: The towns of Treil and Soubar are very friendly trading partners,
and a great many horses and travelers use this road to walk between
the two towns.  Along with townsfolk, many travelers headed eastward
pass through this town as they follow the eastern highway.
52236.name: Northern Gates of Treil

description: The land gradually decends at this point, making its way out of the
ridge between the Thunder Peaks.  Looking to the east you can see a
great forest sprawl out in virtually all directions.  Open plains
extends some distance directly eastward from where you now stand
before the forest engulfs it in the distant east.  Unlike the pine
trees around you, the forested land to the east appears to be composed
of many leafy trees, although the type is unrecognizable to you from
this distance.
52450.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: The road begins to ascend up the embankment slowly.  Its quite a
steep climb, and it leaves you breathless by the time you reach the
top.  The edge of the Reaching Woods has withdrawn once again, and
lies several miles away once more.  Ahead of you, both the road and
the river curve sharply west.
52220.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Nearly anything one could wish to buy can be found in Arabel,
especially exotic goods from far off lands.  A variety of spices and
foreign potery is sold in the open market, along with a great many
types of jewelry and precious gems.
52403.name: Northern Gates of Arabel

description: A ridge here leads further up the side of the eastern mountain,
which obscures your southern view down the mountainside.  The wind
howls down the side of the mountain furiously again, perhaps blowing
in another mountain storm from the east.  Maybe it'd be best if you
got moving...
52472.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: A jackrabbit stands as still as a statue a few feet from the road.
It watches you intently, ready to bound away into some taller grass at
a moment's notice.  A few prairie dogs go about their business
oblivious to your existence.
52452.name: Eastern Highway

description: Here stands a huge storm giant.  Its monstrously big, even for a giant.
A variety of boulders are stacked here also, and the giant is tossing
them down the mountainside with an idiotic grin on its face.  It
hasn't taken note of you yet, so best get out of here while you still
can.
52342.name: {*A Dead End{x

description: Sheer cliffs are on your east, and its still a long long way down.
A few birds have made nests on the sides of the cliff where small
pieces of rock jut out.  A couple of these nests are occupied, and
their inhabitants chirp at you.
52393.name: Three Hundred Feet Up

description: The trail continues eastward here, the Reaching Woods loom closer
as you head toward them.  This area doesn't feel particularly safe.
The main roadway would probably be a lot safer.
52239.name: A Path Off of the Main Road

description: Directly east of you an expanse of low rolling hills stretches out.
Mostly covered with brush, and a few scattered trees, these hills
appear to be largely uncultivated and sparsely inhabited.  However,
after going east for a bit longer the road appears to veer off to the
south, away from this hilly area.
52234.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Tilverton stands here.  Although a mountain town, much influence
has come from expanses of the western deserts and Tilverton has a
great population of arab-like people.  Water is a particularly
important traded commoditity here, as people that plan to cross the
desert must take a great stock of it with them.
52438.name: Southern Gates of Tilverton

description: The valleys west of you are covered by forest and interrupted only by a few lakes and streams.
The mountain pass on which you now travel heads north, just west of
the snowcapped peaks to the east.  Below you to the west lie several
valleys, densly carpeted with pines.  A few streams and lakes can be
seen between the green of the forests.  There appears to be no roads
or trails that lead down into the valleys below.
52469.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: They look very cool and {Crefreshing{x...
The trail continues up a steep hill to the east.  The water of the
river on your east can be heard clearly as it gushes down a series of
rapids and small waterfalls.  A cool breeze blows southwest from the
mountains to your north.
52269.name: Eastern Highway

description: The trees are a bit less thick here than they were off to the
south.  Further into the forest you can now see smaller trees growing
from the forest floor, desperately reaching for the sun.  The sun is
brighter because of occasional breaks in the canopy overhead.  It
filters down to the ground upon which you walk in spotty blotches,
making strange shapes upon the ground, as if the trees were making
shadowpuppets for your amusement.
52463.name: A Forest Road

description: The eastern gates of Arabel open to the eastern road that leads
into the Hullack forest, and through the southern Thunder peaks.  By
avoiding the dangerous reaches east of the Thunder Peaks, travelers
can traverse the land in relative saftey by taking this more southern
route.
52413.name: Eastern Gates of Arabel

description: Birds glide through the air overhead.
The road continues on and on, slowly descending as it heads
northwest across the rocky mountain fields.  A few birds can be seen
overhead, the telltale sign that you aren't nearly as high as you were
several miles back.
52373.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: Two tall peaks rise to your northwest and northeast.  The highway
winds its way between these two prominant peeks, into the rocky area
inbetween them.  The land is a desolate area, filled with cliffs and
jagged outcroppings of rock.  Hardly any vegitation can be seen
growing in the rocky soil around you.
52417.name: Approaching the Storm Horn Mountains

description: {wGnawed bones cover the ground, stained with {rblood{x
Several gnawed bones are scattered around here, coated with dried
blood.  Bits and pieces of cloth, perhaps the remnants of clothing,
are also strewn about.  A broken sword lies near the tattered cloth,
also coated with dried blood.
52346.name: {*A Narrow Trail{x

description: You stand at the eastern gates of Soubar.  No guards stand on the
outskirts of the city, travelers and townsfolk come and go as they
please without interruption.  A variety of carts laiden with farm
goods and pulled by beasts of burden roll past you.
52232.name: Eastern Gates of Soubar

description: To the south lie high bluffs.  These eventually lead up to the edge
of the southern mountains.  Fortunately the road on which you now
travel heads northeast, away from the southern hills and towards
flatter, but higher land.
52448.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: The land becomes more rocky.  You can see protruding rocks from the
light green grass of the pastures on either side of the highway.  The
highway also becomes more rocky, and you notice a variety of discarded
carts with broken axles lying alongside the road.
52263.name: Eastern Highway

description: Not far south lies the town of Scornubel, located on the River
Reaching.  The river itself is within view from where you stand, and
if you listen intently you can just hear the sound of rushing water.
A tall sign stands at the edge of the road.
52212.name: Approaching Scornubel

description: An old half rotted sign post is mounted on a nearbye tree.  A
narrow dirt trail leads north from this spot into a more heavily
wooded area of pines and fir trees.  The main highway continues its
march eastward endlessly.
52293.name: Eastern Highway

description: The air here is much cooler after climbing to this height.  You are
still far below even the lowest of the mountains to your north and
south, though.  Looking back to the west you can see that you've
actually climbed quite high compared to where the edge of the forest
and Tilverton sits below you.
52449.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: The roadway turns east here into some woods.  Although not
particularly dense, these woods have quite a bit of underbrush.  Some
of this hangs over the highway, making it narrower than it should be.
Several plants of poison ivy also hang over into the road.  Be
careful, or you'll touch their leaves.
52484.name: Eastern Highway

description: A strong breeze rustles the tops of the trees, yet you can't even
feel a breath of air where you stand.  The road twists about east in
such a manner that you can't see more than a few hundred feet ahead of
or behind you at most points.  At times you feel completely lost, only
the sun gives away the true direction you travel.
52465.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: Although the twin peaks loom to the east and west of you, their
shadow offers little protection from the blazing sun.  A hot dry
northwestern wind blows, parching your mouth instantly.  The highway
climbs a few of the smaller mountains and winds its way east through
the numerous crags and cliffs of the area.
52418.name: {*Within the Storm Horns{x

description: The well worn road curves east and turns south here.  A great
expanse of land opens up in front of you.  Off to your east and west,
small farmsteads can be seen.  South, far off into the distance, the
road skirts some small brownish colored hills.
52201.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The road twists down the side of the mountain.  The northern side
of this mountain is steep enough to cause you to to give special
attention to your footing.  Although wide enough for carriages and
horses to ride on this road, its doubtful they could make it at such a
steep incline.
52476.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: Uggggg.....it's {YHOT{x
The sun beats down on your face with ferocity.  The trees that
offered some shade along the side of the highway have all but
disappeared.  Only a cool west breeze offers some relief, blowing off
the waters of the river running about 300 yards east of you.
52257.name: Eastern Highway

description: This road branches off to the south from the eastern highway and
leads to the town of Berdusk.  Although not as major of a roadway as
the eastern highway, it sees its share of traffic from people
traveling between Berdusk and the towns to the north and west.
52227.name: The Road to Berdusk

description: More farms and farmhouses are on either side of the road.  The
river, which still runs parallel to the highway, begins to turn in a
more easternly direction.  Farmland and pastures stretch out as far as
the eye can see in all directions.
52250.name: Eastern Highway

description: The boulders in the distance almost look like gigantic figures squatting close to the ground.
The brush starts to thin, replaced by a few small bushes and trees.
Beyond this vegitation, the brown open earth stretches to the distant
pines on the mountain's edge.  A few more boulders lie in the near
distance, strange round foreign objects in this bleak landscape.
52290.name: Eastern Highway

description: They are mostly composed of oaks and elms.
More poison ivy and thistle grows along the road here, thriving in
the woods.  A few strange birds scream out, causing quite a racket.
Although they sound extremely odd, you can't seem to actually see one
of these birds, no matter how hard you look.  A few robins hop around
the forest floor, busily looking for worms.
52485.name: Eastern Highway

description: The hawk circles over your head noiselessly.
The wind howls past you, flowing down from the mountains to the
north.  It bounces off the rocks and boulders of the area and creates
a dull roaring sound.  A tan hawk flies noiselessly overhead, probably
searching for its latest meal.
52429.name: Eastern Highway

description: The dark green forest looks rather uninviting.
The pine woods thins and end further down the side of the mountain,
opening into a vast expanse of plainland.  The spiderhaunt woods lie
to the northwest, alongside the eastern side of the Thunder Peaks to
the north.  To the far east, more forest stretches off into the
distance.  A light drizzle begins to fall from the rolling clouds
overhead.
52477.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: To the east lies the Ashaba River.  A small marsh lies south of the
road.  Cattails and waterplants grow so thick that the standing water
can only be seen in a few places.  A variety of bugs chirp from the
roadside, and several bullfrogs croak from somewhere near the murky
water's surface.
52456.name: Eastern Highway

description: They are quite {-c{-o{-l{-o{-r{-f{-u{-l{-l{x.
A group of colorful butterflies flutters above the road here.  You
continue south alongside the river, the edge of the forest grows
closer to you still.  You see a doe grazing about a hundred yards
away, oblivious to your presence.
52217.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The valley becomes wider here, opening up into a flatter expanse of
land.  The road continues east, while heading slightly lower.
Although mountains lie on your north and south, no mountains lie on
your east and the valley opens up into green flatlands as the Storm
Horns end far away to your east.
52382.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: The smooth black rock that made up much of the area before this has
completely disappeared.  Warn greyish stone has replaced it.  This
rock makes the area look older, but less menacing.  It is also much
easier to see holes and crevices in the rock beside the roadway.
52372.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: They stare down at you from far overhead.
High mountains loom over you to your east.  It's as if gigantic
beings are standing there, carefully examining your journey across
their territory.  Their summits twist toward the sky, displaying
grotesque mannerisms as they stare upward.
52370.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: The road continues northeast.  You notice that the ground is lower
here than a few miles back, and you keep going down a gradual incline.
The mountains are now a ways behind you, but still very prominent in
the southern view.  A few birch trees dot the plains here and there as
you continue northward.
52481.name: Eastern Highway

description: A row of large oaks run north and south here, numerous acorns lie
everywhere.  Countless squirrels run all over the place, chattering
and leaping from branch to branch.  An orange tomcat lies quietly
behind some shrubbery, patiently waiting for an unassuming squirrel to
wander close enough to pounce.
52254.name: Eastern Highway

description: They have a fresh evergreen scent...
You now stand in the shadow of the mountains to the north.  Its
notably cooler here than a few miles ago, and the north breeze has
completely subsided.  More and more pine trees line both sides of the
road.  Fewer large oaks and spruces, which mostly made up the woods to
the west, can be seen up ahead.
52316.name: Eastern Highway

description: The forest roadway turns north here, deeper into the forest.  The
road runs past a large grove of thornbushes, making waundering from
the roadway a difficult and painful experience.  The bushes are
blooming, and you can smell the potent fragrance emanating from their
small white flowers.
52461.name: A Forest Road

description: A flat expanse of land opens up before you.  You are still very
high up, but on a kind of rock plateau that extends several miles
before another mountain crops up.  There are some weeds and even a
small tree or two growing in some of the larger cracks of the rock
floor upon which you now walk.
52366.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: The reinforced walls of High Horn rise over you, broken only by the
strong iron gates that serve as an entrance to this mountain town.
The town has had many problems with goblin raids, and isolated troll
incidents, especially as of late.
52386.name: Western Gates of High Horn

description: The roadway continues to the southeast, away from the mountains to
the north and toward the seas to the east.  Many riders on horseback
pass you, but few carts or carriages venture over this part of the
highway.
52284.name: A Road

description: An open patch of earth has been cleard of dead brush here.  A small
circle of blackened rocks surrounded by an innumerable number of
footprints tells the tale of a great many campfires made by travelers
of the roadway to the north.  No other paths lead from this makeshift
campsite.
52288.name: A Small Clearing in the Brushland

description: The edge of the Reaching Woods is just a few hundred yards away.
The trail grows noticably rougher here, obviously the road has seen
less traffic from here on out.  Small white flowers with purple edges
line the road, and a variety of butterflies and bees fly about you in
the air, dining on the nector of the flowers.
52218.name: The Eastern Highway

description: They are capped with {wsnow{x and lie on the mountains to the north and east of you.
The snowcapped peaks of the higher Thunder Mountains are clearly
discernable from the position where you now stand.  Much of the lower
region of the mountains are densly wooded, the view is actually quite
breathtaking.  It would be all the more beautiful if the road that you
now follow wasn't headed straight toward them...
52434.name: Eastern Highway

description: A western cliff reveals a considerable drop below.  To your west is
the sheer wall of another cliff.  The roadway precariously follows a
ledge between the two cliffs, which winds around the northern side of
the mountain and eventually past the Thunder Peaks into the forests to
the north.  Several clouds overhead drop a few stray raindrops upon
your head.
52473.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: Although both the road and river take a sharp westward turn here,
the woods thicken out to your south.  As you ascend a small hill it
looks almost as if the path will lead you straight into the forest.
However, at the top of the hill you can see that the trail curves west
up ahead, just as it meets with the edge of the Reaching Woods.
52222.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Untrimmed purple lilac bushes line the side of the road here,
growing naturally.  The bundles of purple flowers dampen the air with
a sickeningly sweet aroma.  A great many bees and butterflies have
assembled here to drink the pollen of the flowers.
52261.name: Eastern Highway

description: The town of High Horn is fairly large, but very compact.  Houses
are small, and built close to one another, likely for protection.  The
streets are heavily guarded, and watch towers dot the city.  There are
large lumber and mining industries in High Horn, and the city is
crowded with lumberjacks and miners buying goods.
52387.name: Eastern Gates of High Horn

description: The highway curves north ahead, leaving behind the last of the pine
trees to the southwest.  Fields of high grass blow in the wind,
forming waves of green much like waves on the ocean.  A fresh breeze
blows on the wind, bringing a refreshing scent to your nose.  A few
wild horses can be seen grazing on grass to the north, near the edge
of the forest.
52451.name: Eastern Highway

description: Here stands the western gates of the river town of Iraebor.  The
town sees quite a bit of traffic up and down the river from farmers
hauling goods and lumberjacks sending lumber downstream.  The town is
filled will skilled craftsmen, particularly woodcutters and
carpenters.
52271.name: Western Gates of Iriaebor

description: Tilverton lies in the shadow of the Thunder Mountains, and past the
northern gates the eastern highway leads into this chain of mountains.
Although the Thunder Peaks still have dangerous creatures within them,
they are not nearly so rugged or unexplored as the Storm Horns to the
west.
52439.name: Northern Gates of Tilverton

description: The eastern road continues downhill into a dark, forbidding forest.
Because no major cities lie close on this road, it is not well
travelled, but still fairly well maintained.  Be prepared for a long
journey if you head this way.
52416.name: A Road

description: The floorboards are rotting away, and many have completely
collapsed.  Large holes in the ceiling allow shafts of light to filter
down into the room, partially illuminating it.  A possom hangs from
the rafters in the far corner of the room sleeping.  Tables, chairs,
and an old bar still exist, although slowly rotting away after
exposure to the elements.  Broken glass bottles and even a few coins
lie behind the bar and under the remains of a barstool.
52307.name: An Abandoned Inn

description: The city is too far away to make out clear sights, or hear sounds.
To the southeast lies the town of Ashbenford.  The city lies on the
edge of the woods to the south.  The gleam of reflected sunlight from
the polished iron gates of the city catches your eye, even this far
away.  Running from the north woods to the west of Ashbenford lies the
river Ashaba.  The highway crosses it a few miles beyond where you now
stand.
52455.name: Eastern Highway

description: The land becomes more of a pronounced wilderness around you.  Its
obvious that this trail isn't used often.  This land presents a kind
of empty loneliness, as if it were sorrowfully reminiscing about times
in the past that were far happier.
52289.name: Eastern Highway

description: The forest ends here abruptly.  The road continues north towards
the town of Shadowdale.  Several houses can be seen off to the
northeast, however their windows and doors are boarded up, and several
holes can be seen in the roofs even from this distance.  No trees
stand to the north, although a few blackened stumps still poke through
the ground.
52498.name: Pathway to the Shire of Shadowdale

description: Gigantic strawberry patches stretch to the east and west for
several miles.  Several adults and children are on their hands and
knees picking the ripe fruit.  You can just make out the scent of ripe
strawberries.
52208.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The small fish of the Ashaba river dart around quickly.
The Ashaba River flows here, the water is a bit murky from dirt
stirred up near the marsh.  A few small fish can be seen in the
shallows, hunting for food to eat.  Some of the standing pools are
quite pungent, an unpleasent stink hangs about the marshlands to the
south.
52457.name: Crossing the Ashaba River

description: Some wooden planks lie here discarded by their owner.
A brisk breeze kicks up some dust around you.  Most of earth is
bare, so even the slightest breeze can hurl dirt into your eyes.  The
remains of several empty broken barrels along with some old planks lie
next to the roadway, discarded by some unknown traveller.
52300.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road winds around the western edge of the boulder, and between
several smaller boulders in its path.  The sun shines less brightly in
this area again, giving a somewhat unpleasent darkness to the area.  A
hundred yards ahead to the west the path begins a steep descent, and
a cave branches off to the south.
52364.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: The River stretches alongside your west here, and the road closely
follows it.  To your east lies a dense wood whose edge lies scarcely a
mile away.  You can easily make out the distinctive shape of the tall
trees that stand on its border.
52216.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The trail leads you to the western gates of the town of Soubar.
This bustling town has a large marketplace, much of it for the crops
that are raised in the farmsteads around Soubar.  Most of the small
wooden houses in Soubar are tightly packed together, but a fair amount
also have brick chimneys and porches.
52200.name: Western Gates of Soubar

description: You follow the small trail down the side of the mountain.  The
steep mountain side rises up on your north, and there is a deep ravine
to the north.  There is no breeze on this side of the moutain, and a
thick musty earthy smell is in the air, almost making it hard to
breath.
52344.name: {*A Narrow Trail{x

description: The sprawling town of Arabel lies out before you.  One of the
centers of trade and commerce in the realms, Arabel sits between the
Storm Horn Mountains, the seas of the south, and the forests to the
west.  A constant stream of traffic enters and exits the city which
includes travelers, carriages, carts, traders, knights, and farmers.
52410.name: Western Gates of Arabel

description: You begin once again up the mountain side.  The climb isn't as
steep or rugged as before, and the highway is wider and more carefully
kept.  Occasionally a manmade sign appears next to the road, pointing
north in the direction of the town of High Horn.
52380.name: {*A Mountain Road{x

description: The rain of boulders seems to have stopped here, but once again you
feel as if your being watched.  In fact, every once in awhile you
catch a glimps of several pairs of beady eyes from the cliffs overhead
or from within caves or cracks in the mountainside.
52339.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: They are extremely sharp and jagged.  Take care not to slip on them.
The rock underneath your feet is more shiney and black than it was
in the southern part of the Storm Horns.  It looks as if it could be
obsideon, or perhaps a type of granite.  The highway ascends up a
smaller mountain in front of you.  Take care not to slip and fall on
one of the jagged rocks that lie along the roadway.
52355.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: It's amazing you can see some of these mountains so clearly at this distance.  They must be unbelievably high.
As your path has continued its northeast direction, the mountains
to your north have dipped further southward.  They stand a few hundred
miles off.  You can now make out their individual peaks and snowcapped
summits.  Its also now possible to realize the full extent of their
staggering height, which stretches upward toward the sky as if they
were trying to touch the sun itself.
52292.name: Eastern Highway

description: The mountains end shortly, but steep hills remain for quite some
distance.  The region is still very arid, the only vegitation is sight
is some brush and tumbleweed.  A northwestern breeze once again blows
across your face, drying out your mouth and getting sand in your eyes.
52422.name: {*Within the Storm Horns{x

description: The road continues south, toward the Lake of Dragons and the high
seas to the southeast.  Eventually this road leads to Suzail, and the
other port cities along the Lake of Dragons and the seas beyond.
52415.name: A Road

description: The road begins another climb.  Looking back on the flat expanse of
land you just traversed over, it appears to be a gigantic bowl within
the mountsides of the Storm Horns.  In fact, it may even be that a
large mountain lake was present there ages ago.  To the south, endless
mountain tops of the Storm Horns can be seen, the sunset mountains
have completely disappeared from view.
52371.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: {YY{wellow creste{Yd{x birds sit on the bridge, waiting to swoop down and catch a fish.
A large stone bridge stretches over to the west bank of the
Reaching River.  The clear water rushes below you, making a gurgling
noise.  The trail resumes its course on the eastern side of the river.
Several yellow-crested birds perch atop the grey stones that make up
the bridge, waiting patiently for their next meal.
52215.name: A Bridge Across the Reaching River

description: Rolling hills spread out through the valley.  To the south, the
western edge of the High Horns stop.  Woods composed of tall trees
cover much of the hills, especially to the south.  Some areas along
the roadside have been cleared of all trees, probably logged by
lumberjacks from High Horn.
52398.name: Eastern Highway

description: A campfire burns brightly within a small patch of cleared forest.
Obviously someone has been using this recently, but who would camp out
in a place like this?
52242.name: A Camp Within the Wood

description: Crops of all types can be seen growing on the farmland around the
highway.  Workers can be seen tending to the fields or mending fences,
however most of the children and women that can be seen are around the
farmhouses and not in the fields themselves.  Perhaps people in this
area are still cautious of the danger that lurks in the western
mountains.
52406.name: Eastern Highway

description: The birch trees are thin, but quite high.
A few lonely birch trees stand out against the bleak landscape.
However, they only make your surroundings seem more lonely and barren.
The only signs of life are crows that caw at your presence from the
branches of some small bushes a few yards from the roadway.
52281.name: Eastern Highway

description: You start the long climb up the southern edge of the mountains.
The mountain the highway traverses is not an extremely tall one, but
the mountains to the east and west are very intimidating.  The
mountains are so high above you they seem to connect together, you
almost feel as if your passing through some enourmous arch made of
rock.
52466.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: You follow the small natural valley deeper into the Storm Horns.
The mountains are so quiet that the intent listener can hear city
noises from the town of High Horn now only several miles off to the
east.  The road heads straight to High Horn, taking the only route the
valley has to offer.
52381.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: The spiderhaunt forest is a few miles north of the road.  The black
and twisted trees of the forest allow little light in, who knows what
evil creatures lurk within its depths.  Fortunately the road only
skirts the eastern edge of the woods, without actually submerging into
them.  A few trees lie on the northern edge of the highway, offering a
bit of shade from the bright sun.
52479.name: Eastern Highway

description: The southern gates of the city of Scornubel overlook the bridge
that leads across the Reaching River.  A cool western breeze brings
refreshment from the swealtering heat of the city, and the sounds of
the river can be heard not far off.
52214.name: Southern Gates of Scornubel

description: It looks as if deer have recently crossed the roadside while it was muddy.
These sharp little stones are quite annoying.  They'd probably go right though footware without a good heel.
The roadway, although still fairly well kept, now has has
occasional small protruding stones from its surface.  There are signs
of wildlife in the area, their tracks can be seen not far from the
roadway.  The River Reaching has entirely faded from view to the
north, its path takes it directly to the base of the Sunset Mountains.
52276.name: Eastern Highway

description: The wind howls angrily in this region.  Only a few trees stand to
block its rage, those trees that do stand in the area are twisted and
tilted from the wind and half-dead from lack of water.  The south wind
nearly knocks you down at times, as it whips down from the mountains
to the north.
52308.name: Eastern Highway

description: Sharp rocks assult your feet constantly.
The path leads down into one of the ravines from the mountainside.
It descends very steeply, amid boulders and sharp rocks at the bottom
of this gorge.  The land is extremely rugged, and the going is very
slow due to the care that must be taken to avoid the sharp rocks on
either side of you.
52365.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: A few trees grow here, there's actually some soil on the ground
instead of the hard rock you've become accustomed to.  More trees and
brush grows in the rocky soil along the sides of the cliffs to the
north and south.  You can see an old mine on the northern cliffs, a
few rusted old mining carts stand idly by its entrance.
52383.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: You stand before the mountain town of High Horn.  High stone walls
surround the town, long barbs protruding from the top of the walls.
Every so often a tower rises up from the barbs, and several lookouts
wielding sharp halberds can be seen from within them.  The surrounding
area must be dangerous for a town to have such defenses.
52385.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: It looks as if it was carrying something of a tanish color, the inside of the wood is still stained.
Several old carts stand next to the trail, almost entirely rotten.
A small building can be seen in the distance, lying in a natural
clearing of pine trees.  It looks ancient and decrepit, and almost all
the paint has long since entirely peeled off.  Several abandoned carts
and barrels lie around the trail.
52305.name: Path to a Small Inn

description: Large footprints have been made in the dust, far too big to be human, elf, or dwarf.
A very unpleasent stench greets your nose here.  The odor smells
like a combination between rotten meat and very bad body odor.  The
trail widens a bit as it climbs higher up the slope of the mountains.
You can see several large footprints recently made made in the dust of
the path you now follow.
52347.name: {*A Narrow Trail{x

description: Extremely high bluffs lie between you and the mountains to the
north.  To the south lie bluffs as well, although not as pronounced as
those to the north.  Dark oaks line the hillsides of the south, only
the rock cliffs peek out at you from opening within the green forests.
52399.name: Eastern Highway

description: This stake reads 77 and 1/2...
Hills errupt from the formerly flat landscape.  These foothills
lead all the way up to the Thunder Mountains.  The road follows a
northern route through the hills, taking the most flat and direct
route up into the cradle in the mountains to the northeast.  A few
well-cut stakes are placed next to the highway every half-mile or so,
perhaps as distance markers of some sort.
52433.name: Eastern Highway

description: The hills end ahead, declining into a sprawling rocky wilderness.
Although not quite as dry or sandy as the area to your south, the
region is more akin to a desert than anything else, especially to the
north.  Very high mountains rise up east of you.  These mountains
aren't nearly as rocky or jagged as the Storm Horns, however.
52423.name: On the Edge of the Storm Horns

description: The Tun river flows a few miles to your east, beyond that looms the
Storm Horn Mountains.  The highway winds its way directly into these
mountains after crossing the Tun river.  Although not as high as the
Sunset Mountains behind you, the Storm Horn Mountains seem rugged and
wild.  Crags and spires of rock jut up from their sides.  Their peaks,
although not covered with snow, reach upward like fingers beckoning
you onward.
52327.name: Eastern Highway

description: To the north is the town of Tilverton, which stands within the
natural cradle of the Thunder Peaks.  The eastern highway runs through
Tilverton, then forks into two seperate pieces.  The northern piece of
the highway runs north then east between the highest of the peaks.
The eastern section of the highway runs through a larger natural break
between the mountains, too big to be a valley.  The chain of mountains
resumes further south and east from this opening.
52437.name: Approaching Tilverton

description: They coat most of the road surface.
You can still see the mountains over the trees, and the sun is high
in the sky, but little else can be viewed.  The area is strangely
quiet, few birds or animals make noise from the branches of the trees
of the forest around you.  Pine needles lightly coat about half the
road's surface.  Beyond the road pine needles coat the earth so
thickly that no soil can be seen.
52444.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: It would be pretty easy to climb up one of those ladders and snatch a nice juicy peach...
You pass an orchard on your left.  Large, ripe peaches hang loosely
from the branches.  Several ladders lean against the trees,
unattended.  Large wicker baskets lie around the ladders, half filled
with freshly picked fruit from the trees.
52255.name: Eastern Highway

description: The last of the eastern Thunder Peaks stands to your north.  The
forest of pines thins a bit here.  Several grassy knolls can be seen
to the east, completely void of all trees.  Every once in awhile a
cloud overhead produces a shower.  It seems the eastern side of the
mountains is quite wetter than the western side.
52464.name: Eastern Highway

description: {*Black{x ravens circle overhead, perhaps hoping your their next meal...
Several well worn trails lead up and down here, while the highway
continues eastward.  A couple ravens circle overhead, an odd sight so
deep within the mountains.  A cold wind blows down from the higher
northern mountain tops.
52340.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: Named the bridge of fallen men, this is a somber sight indeed.
A strong wooden bridge spans the distance over the river.  Large
beams bolted together hold the thick planks firmly in place.  The
bridge could easily support the weight of several large carriages at
once, but to fall in the frothing river here would most likely mean
death.
52330.name: {*Crossing the Bridge of {*F{walle{*n M{we{*n

description: The Sunset Mountains tower over you to the north and east, blocking out most of the sunlight.
The sunset mountains rise up high on two sides of you; the north
and east.  You stand in their shadow, the mountain chain seems to be
one gigantic open hand reaching toward you, closing around you.
Fortunately, the shadows of the mountain protect you somewhat from the
furious glare of the sun.
52427.name: Eastern Highway

description: CHIRP! CHIRP! CHIRP!
The tops of the trees are just underneath you, it almost looks as
if you have a leaf carpet to walk on.  Except you can't walk in
midair, of course.  More birds chirp at you from these branches, and
the wind whips at you.
52395.name: A Hundred Feet Up

description: The flat, grassy plain continues on.  Small farmhouses and cottages
begin to appear once again.  Every so often a farmer working in his
fields spots you and waves.  Its obvious the road is more welled
travelled and kept here, weeds and grass have been neatly kept in
check all along its dirt surface.
52228.name: The Eastern Highway

52349.name: A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains

description: East of you in the distance stands a thick forest, the color of
which appears to be almost black compared to the light green grass
growing between it and you.  Behind this looms the rugged peaks of
tall mountins, of which the tallest you can clearly see contains a cap
of snow.
52210.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The endless pastureland continues on.  Every once in awhile you see
sheep or cattle in the fields.  However, other than the travelers you
occasionally meet, you see little other evidence of other living
beings.
52265.name: Eastern Highway

description: The flatness begins to change into a series of rolling hills.  Upon
these hills are small clusters of different kinds of trees.
Occasionally these trees signal the existance of a small stream
running across the open ground.  Most of these streams run north to
south.  Although the highway never crosses one, it does come close
enough for you to get a good glimpse of one every now and then.
52482.name: Eastern Highway

description: Here stand the gates of the city of Scornubel.  The city itself is
quote large, and stretches a fair distance off to the southeast.  The
edge of town lies on the River Reaching far off to the south.  Many
inhabitant of Scornubel are fairly wealthy landowners, and some
monsterous mansions lie in the rich western district of the city.
52213.name: Western Gates of Scornubel

description: Almost immediately hills crop up around you, and the ground becomes
more rocky.  As you continue northward the vegitation grows drier, and
there are also less trees.  This fairly arid region doesn't have many
inhabitants, but it appears the roadway here is still very well
traveled.
52402.name: Eastern Highway

description: You stand on the edge of the Reaching Woods, large trees loom above
you as if standing guard against your intrusion.  Perhaps you
shouldn't be here?
52240.name: Edge of the Reaching Woods

description: Your in midair!  You'd better hope you can fly, or your gonna end
up a pancake.  The view below you is dizzying, it's best if you just
don't look down.
52392.name: Ahh! Your Four Hundred Feet Up!

description: They're {wsnow{x capped peaks can be seen clearly from your position.
As the highway continues to the east, the mountains to your north
continue their walk to the south.  In fact, for the first time you can
see the full extent of the height of these mountains as their jagged
peaks reach toward the sky.  Great crevasses can be seen along the
slopes, hiding unimaginable depths.  Forested valleys can be seen
inbetween the great rocky walls.  Higher up the mountains, beyond the
treeline, snow and ice cover the mountains as if sloppily covered with
frosting.
52313.name: Eastern Highway

description: You come upon the mouth of a large cave in the side of the
mountain.  It's as if the cave is yawning at you.  Inside there is
total darkness, you can't see anything.  Displaced stones and rocks
near its entrance make it clear that something or somethings have
recently been walking back and forth through its gaping maw.
52353.name: {*The Mouth of A Cave{x

description: It shines {Ybrightly{x overhead.
You continue along the flat rocky land between the mountains.  The
sun shines brightly overhead, and this area is notably warmer than the
other parts of the mountain range.  There isn't a hint of a breeze,
however, and the air seems a bit stifling.
52368.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: The sound of water can still be heard here from the Ashaba River
off to the south.  Mosquitoes are thick here, the little bloodsuckers
land all over your face and neck trying to gorge themselves on your
blood.  There must be standing water around here somewhere.
52490.name: Eastern Highway

description: The ascent up the side of the mountain is steep and arduous.  A
strong wind blowing down the mountain side makes it all the more
difficult.  Scattered pine woods rise up on both sides of you,
obscuring the view further up the mountainside.  Several dead branches
lie in the middle of the roadway, probably blown down by the strong
winds that are usually present in this area.
52467.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: The plains and rolling hills continue on, periodically interupted
by clumps of trees and bushes.  To the northwest a large river can be
seen flowing southeast.  The dark Spiderhaunt woods begins to thin and
end a short distance ahead of you to the north.  The area north of
these woods is dominated by grassy hills, much like the area in which
you now walk.
52483.name: Eastern Highway

description: The markings on the rock might be some strange letters, but its indiscernible to you.
The wind howls at you now from the cliffs above and below where you
stand.  Several rocks near you have odd markings carved into them, as
if a sword had been thrust upon them many times over.  The path
continues its endless climb upward from here.  These mountains seem
neverending.
52358.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: The roadway declines down another ravine here, although a bit
smaller.  The rock surfaces along this natural fissure are worn down
and smooth, suggesting that at one time water flowed here freely.  You
have an extensive view of a few miles ahead of the highway, and you
can see it snake northwest back up through the mountains.
52369.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: It looks quite refreshing.  Perhaps you should take a drink, this might be the last chance you get.
Here you depart the familiar Reaching River.  The road vears off to
the south, the river stretches northward toward the mountains in the
distance.  Its sparkling waters seem crystal clear as they gush past
you westward in the direction of Iriaebor.
52287.name: Eastern Highway

description: To the north and south stretches endless forest.  The road runs
through a grassy plain between the northern and southern forests.
Slowly the edges of the forest draw closer, causing the expanse of
land on which you now stand to grow steadily smaller.  The land ahead
of you is lower than that behind you, and as you head east away from
the mountains you come to lower and lower ground.
52454.name: Eastern Highway

description: Giant elms line the roadside, offering a cool place to rest from
the sun's hot glare.
Giant oaks line the roadside, offering a cool place to rest from
the sun's hot glare.
The road bends southeast here.  In the far distance, along the
horizon, you can just barely make out the outline of some snow capped
mountains to the northeast.  A few scattered oak and elm trees line
the road, offering refreshing shade to hot and tired travelers.  The
lower branches of these trees have been neatly trimmed, so as not to
disrupt tavelers using the road.
52244.name: Eastern Highway

description: The large city of Arabel stretches out eastward.  The crop fields
wander right up to the city walls in some places.  However, no farmers
or merchants can be seen selling crops or other wares outside the city
itself.  Guards patrol this area carefully, they watch you intently as
you continue eastward toward the western gates of Arabel.
52408.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road stretches as far as the eye can see, winding southeast
through the farmland and low rolling hills of the area.  Farmhouses
dot the landscape around you, and every so often you can hear the
sound of farm animals carried across the breeze to your ears.  The
road is exremely wide and well kept, allowing trade and travel between
Soubar and the other towns and villages of the area.
52202.name: The Eastern Highway

description: A large boulder close to you {Csparkles{x from some hidden quartz within.
Shiny {Cquartz{x rock sparkles at you from a nearby boulder.
Several dried up streambeds run parallel to the roadway here,
indicating that at one point in time this land used to be less dry
than it is now.  More boulders lie scattered about, and every once in
awhile the sparkle of an embedded quartz rock within these boulders
catches your eye.
52311.name: Eastern Highway

description: Deep cracks cover the area, if you fall down one you might never get back up.
The path winds to the northwest, away from the higher mountains to
the northeast.  Several cracks five or six feet across lie a few yards
from the road.  They are so deep you can't see the bottom.  A few mice
scurry here and there, searching for seeds.
52367.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: Mmmmmm.....they look pretty tempting.
You pass a vinyard to the west.  Rows upon rows of purple grapes
grows up a multitude of wooden posts mounted in the field.  A sweet
scent rides across the cool breeze from the field.  Several workers
busily but carefuly pluck ripe grapes from their vines and deposit
them into large buckets lying beside them.
52229.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The road turns east here, away from the northern peaks and closer
toward the gigantic mountains to the east.  The woods are thick in
this portion of the mountains.  The pine trees grow all the way up the
side of the mountain to the treeline, where the high snow capped peak
of the mountain makes it impossible for any vegitation to exist.
52471.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: A traveller wearing a brown cloak sits on a rock a few feet from
the road.  He takes no notice of you and continues his vacant stare
down the road.  A small horse is tied up to a nearby tree, and is busy
grazing upon the grass and weeds that grow along the roadside.
52299.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road stretches to the southeast as far as the eye can see.
Crows caw at you from the side of the road apparently angry at your
intrusion, although with the number of travelers on this road, they
should be used to it by now.
52206.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Something glints at you from the chasm below.
Something glints at you from the chasm below.
The breeze is very gusty in these parts of the mountains, and it
can easily blow the unaware traveller off balance and cause him to
fall down to the crags below.  In fact, if you look carefully you can
just make out the glint of several sword hilts in the ravine below,
the telltale sign that some unfortunate adventurer met his bloodly end
there.
52357.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: You stand at the highest point of the highway so far.  Below you
you can see plains and forests spread out beyond the northern edge of
the Thunder Peaks.  Several rivers snake inbetween the forests, and a
few large lakes can be seen far to the northeast.  The Thunder Peaks
stretch to the northwest into the horrizon.
52475.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: You head east, away from the safety of the town of Proskur and into
the wilderness that the road now plunges you into.  Almost immediately
it is easy to see that this road is not well travelled, and not as
well kept as it was before.  You meet a few travellers heading in the
direction of Proskur, but almost none heading in the direction you now
travel.
52324.name: Approaching the Town of Proskur

description: The woods are interrupted occasionally by outcroppings of rock.  To
the south you can see Tilverton.  Further to the south you can make
out the eastern rim of the Storm Horns, below where you now stand.
The wind is extremely violent, and you have to take care not to lose
your footing.
52468.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: It looks as if its about ready to fall apart.
They sleep on the porch of the house quietly.
Its freshly gutted carcass drips of {Rblood{x.
As you continue southward, you notice a farmhouse that lies a few
hundred yards to the east.  Half a dozen dogs lie sleeping on its
porch, and a freshly gutted deer carcass is suspended from a nearby
tree to dry in the sun.  Peeling white paint suggests that the house
is quite old, and in a state of disrepair.
52260.name: Eastern Highway

description: Several mountains have popped up in the west, obscurring your view
of the grasslands below.  Although the path has kept its northward
direction, the mountains have sprung up more westward, so that now you
are travelling deeper into them once again.  In addition, more of the
Storm Horn Mountains lie to your north.
52390.name: {*A Mountain Road{x

description: It is interspursed with small grains of a crystaline substance.
You walk along a flat plain, a lowlands between the Storm Horns
Mountains to the southwest and the Sunset Mountains to the east.  The
sand is a dusty yellow color, but has a shiny glint to it as well.
Upon closer inspection, you notice small crystals intermixed with the
sand and rocks along the ground.  At certain points the sun's
reflection in the sand shines in your eyes brightly, causing you to
look away.
52426.name: Eastern Highway

description: A sudden break in the western mountains reveal open grassland and
forests to the west.  It appears you now stand on the western edge of
the Storm Horn Mountains.  To the east, the highest peaks of the Storm
Horns glare at you menacingly.  Your surroundings are suprisingly
bright and cheery compared to the gloomy mountains to the east and
south from which you just came.
52375.name: {*A Mountain Road{x

description: Brush and small patches of woodland cover this area.  Every so
often, you notice a house or cottage nestled within these patches of
trees.  A few well kept paths leave the marked highway and turn from
the roadway to these houses.  The traffic on the highway has also
become more busy, and you meet up with more and more townsfolk.
52314.name: Eastern Highway

description: They are mostly composed of oaks and elms.
The roadway turns sharply east here, heading into a thicker grove
of trees and bushes.  The ground is a bit soggy, suggesting that it
has recently rained in this area.  A large green toad sits a few feet
from the road's edge, staring at you.
52487.name: Eastern Highway

description: You can tell that the land begins to slope upward here.  Slowly the
orchards and vineyards turn into pastures and prairies.  More and more
animals can be seen grazing in the distance from the road you travel.
The road turns abruptly south here.
52256.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road stretches on.  You meet more and more travellers, mostly
farmers loaded with bags or leading cart-laided mules.  Every once in
awhile you notice a cucumber or tomato lying in the middle the
roadway, doubtlessly dropped unaware from overflowing sacks or bags.
52253.name: Eastern Highway

description: Several stands owned by the local farmers have set up shop here,
selling fresh produce to the local passerby's.  Several small children
run barefoot from traveler to traveler, desperately trying to sell
their freshly picked fruit to any unsuspecting individuals gullible
enough to buy it.
52209.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The road continues along the with the river as it zigzags back and
forth.  At the times when the road comes closer to the bank of the
river, you can feel the spray of its water on your face, driven by the
strong breeze.  A great many and unusual animal tracks can be seen in
the mud between the west side of the road, and the east bank of the
river.
52221.name: The Eastern Highway

description: It looks as if someone made some strange letters in the side of the rock here...
The trail curves south into an extremly narrow valley between two
very high cliffs.  Several rocks in the area have scratches in them,
obviously made intentionally, but unreadable to you.  Hopefully there
aren't any lose rocks on the clifftops far overhead that could fall
onto you.
52345.name: {*A Narrow Trail{x

description: They're {wgrey{x, but you can't really tell much else about them.  They're too far away.
You stand at the base of a large hill.  It will be a steep climb
going up it, but once you make it you should have quite the view.  A
few large gray birds circle noiselessly far overhead.
52295.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road winds itself into a small valley between two large hills.
As you've continued on you've encountered fewer and fewer travellers.
However, the ones you now encounter are a bit more eccentric than most
of those you have previously seen.
52280.name: Eastern Highway

description: Many of the hills around you have one side that cuts off abruptly,
ending in cliffs or outcroppings of exposed rock.  Its almost as if
they were giant waves breaking upon the ground, causing rocks to spill
up from the overturned earth.  The highway cuts across these hills,
taking a path that is fairly straight and even.
52430.name: On the Edge of the Storm Horns

description: A trail, although barely recognizable, leads off the main road
here.  It looks as if a small group of people have stamped all the
grass down, the trail can't be more than a few months old.
52238.name: A Path Off of the Main Road

description: The cleared pathway ends abruptly here, large trees with half
exposed roots stop you from following the trail any further.  If you
venture deeper into the forest, you will doubtlessly become hopelessly
lost.
52243.name: A Dead End Within the Woods

description: The road forks to the northeast and southeast here.  The southern
roadway leads through the desolate brushland to the south.  The
northern roadway continues up to the foothills that eventually turn
into the Sunset Mountains.  Their peaks can be seen far to the north,
poking through the thin greyish looking clouds in the sky above.
52282.name: Eastern Highway

description: The Thunder Peaks stand behind you, looking over your shoulder to
the plains of the north.  The grass of the plains isn't extremely
high, only a foot or so.  Intermixed with the grass are blooming
flowers of all sorts, mostly small blue ones with white trim.  They
are quite fragrant and you can easily make out their sweet odor as it
swims across the breeze.
52478.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: MOOOOOO!
RUFF! RUFF! RUFF!
Livestock graze on the tall grass enclosed by fences on both sides
of you.  A large cow looks up lazily at you while chewing its cud,
apparently you aren't in the least bit interesting to it.  A dog barks
at you menacingly from the porch of a nearby farmhouse.
52230.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The southern gates of Treil stand ungaurd, as did the gates of its
sister town Soubar.  A few riders, mounted on quick riding horses
thunder past you to the south, obviously in quite a hurry.  Farmers
and carts with farm goods and implements can be seen still just about
everywhere.
52237.name: Southern Gates of Treil

description: It has a dumb grin across its face from the field on your right.  Its really not scary at all...
A crossed eyed scarecrow dressed loosely with worn clothing grins
at you from a field on your right.  However, it doesn't seem to be
working, as several large crows caw at you from the field underneath
it.  Maybe someone should have made it a bit more frightening?
52231.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Inside the cave there is total blackness.  Sharp rocks jut out from
the ceiling, floor, and the cave's walls.  The cavern in which you now
stand narrows and continues on deeper into the mountainside.
52363.name: {*Wit{whin {*A Da{wrk C{*ave

description: BAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAANG!!  A
tremendous cracking sound as loud as thunder makes your ears ring.
The earth shudders as a huge boulder lands just a few feet in front of
you.  In a few seconds another boulder whizzes overhead and lands with
a crash in the distance.  You'd better get out of here while you still
can.  But what the heck is going on?
52338.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: The roadway continues north.  You stand on top of a high piece of
land, and the view on all sides is astonashing.  You can see at least
a hundred miles to your west, and you have an excellent view of the
road in front of you.  It continues on northward for some miles, then
turns east back into the mountains.
52391.name: {*A Mountain Road{x

description: Fewer hills and bluffs can be found here than to the west.  In
fact, you've entered what seems to be a natural valley that runs all
the way from inbetween the Sunset and Storm Horn Mountains to where
you now stand.  However, there is still a notable ascent as you
continue to the northeast along the roadway.
52315.name: Eastern Highway

description: Several small animals rustle the half-dead brush west of the
roadway.  Every once in awhile a brown jackrabbit with large ears
pokes its head out and eyes you carefully before making a mad dash
across the highway.  No trees grow in this area, but far off to the
north you can makeout a thick glade of lofty pines.
52275.name: Eastern Highway

description: Arabel lies behind you to your south.  The highway you've been
following turns northward, back toward the northern-most rim of the
Storm Horns, which run far to the west and south.  The area is mostly
unihabited grassland.  Although some livestock grazes in the areas
around you, very little farmland can be seen north of Arabel.
52412.name: Approaching Arabel

description: The Reaching River flows on your east.  The trees on its banks have
disappeared, leaving nothing to obscure its view.  Its clear waters
rush quickly over jagged rocks beneath its steep banks.  If one were
to try to ford this river, clearly this would not be the place.
52266.name: Eastern Highway

description: The highway turns east, and then sharply north after that.  The
road heads toward an indentation within the mountain chain.  Mountains
surround all sides of you except to your west, which is a natural gap
in the Thunder Mountains.  A very tall mountain lies at the end of the
onclave ahead; its height looks intimidating, even from this distance.
52432.name: Eastern Highway

description: The valley containing the town of High Horn becomes wider and wider
as you head east.  After a short distance, the mountains to the south
begin to recede, leaving only the northern peaks to watch over you on
your eastward journey.  Several mining camps can be seen from the
road, suggesting that more mines lie within the mountains.
52384.name: Eastern Highway

description: It seems to be quit the bustling town.
The view from the top of this hill is quite extensive.  Before you
lies the large city of Iriaebor.  Beyond Iriaebor the river and the
highway depart ways, the river flows from the northeast out of the
mountains, while the road continues eastward across the rocky plains.
A steady stream of people can be seen coming and going from Iriabor
via the road you currently walk along.
52270.name: Eastern Highway

description: On the top of this small hill you can see the end of the woods in
the distance, as well as a great expansion of flat land beyond.  The
Reaching River snakes about east and west as far as the eye can see,
the road you are on follows it all the way.
52223.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Your still a few hundred feet in the air, but at least the things
below are a bit more recognizable.  The top of the cliff is far
overhead, have you really come all that way down already?
52394.name: Two Hundred Feet Up

description: The sun is visable above the mountain tops, casting a {Yyellow{x glow down upon the mountainside.
Clouds bubble across the northern sky, a storm is brewing.
The mountains seem brighter here, illuminated by the light of the
sun that was hidden in the lower reaches of the mountains to the
south.  However, it is quite chilly here, as you are very high up.
The breeze also remains brisk.  Dark clouds roll across the north.
Being rained on while hiking up these mountains would not be
pleasant...
52360.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: The river makes a great many sharp turns east and west, zig-zagging
across the open plains southward.  Birch trees now seperate the
roadway and the river.  Thick foliage grows at their feet, grasshopers
and other insects jump across the roadway.  The potent aroma of
honeysuckle wafts toward your nose as you follow the road southwest.
52245.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Several trees now line the side of the road, offering some precious
shade to weary and heat-scortched travelers.  Every once in awhile,
you notice suspicious characters hiding behind these trees, and you
feel as if your being watched.
52211.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Several large mountains loom in front of you, to the north.  The
road continues to the north and east, into these higher mountains.
The mountains in front of you seem a bit less rugged than those
further to the south and east, and a bit less foreboding.
52379.name: {*A Mountain Road{x

description: The highway turns to the northwest here, following the River
Reaching.  Although the landscape is fairly barren and bleak, the
highway is clearly well traveled here, and you meet all kinds of
strange and interesting people as you continue on.  A tall sign is
posted along the side of the road.
52268.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road turns sharply north, and continues on through the heavily
forested area.  Long vines stretch down from the leafy branches of
trees far above, twisting around each other as they reach toward the
ground.  Some of these vines even hang over the road, although none
actually reach down onto the road's surface.
52462.name: A Forest Road

description: You stand on the outskirts of the bustling town of Soubar.  You can
hear the quiet murmer of the city not far away, and the odor of fresh
produce and baked goods sold in its streets wafts across the breeze.
Eastward lies a road that stretches far into the distance.
52233.name: Outskirts of Soubar

description: The Reaching River splits in two here.  One part of the river
stretches southeast, while the other flows from the northeast.  The
highway follows the northern branch of the river, flowing from the
Sunset Mountains to the north.
52267.name: Eastern Highway

description: They are mostly composed of oaks and elms.
The sound of rushing water is very loud here.  The Ashaba River
runs before the road, a rickety old wooden bridge crosses it.  A few
of the planks are noticably rotten and cracked.  It wouldn't be
pleasent to fall into the swift waters below, or the jagged rocks that
are scattered throughout the narrow riverbed.
52489.name: Crossing the Ashaba River

description: It {Cgushes{x quickly and noisily past you eastward.
All is quiet as you stand in the shadow of the Storm Horn
Mountains.  The deep but narrow Tun River flows before you, rushing
quickly over smooth grey stones washed down from the mountains.
Several yellow flowers with orange trim grow next to the river, a
stark contrast to the rest of your surroundings.
52329.name: Eastern Highway

description: Although you now walk along the western edge of the mountains, high
cliffs still seperate you from the grasslands below.  The highway
travels straight north, and up several of these higher cliffs.
Through the grasslands to the west a river snakes southward, most
likely the Tun.
52376.name: {*A Mountain Road{x

description: The area to the east of the river is quite different than that to
the west of it.  Grasslands lie to the north, but to the east an
abundance of farmland can be seen.  Small farmhouses surrounded by
fences dot the gently rolling hillsides.  Carefully tended crops bask
in the bright sunlight.
52405.name: Eastern Highway

description: To the east lies the town of Berdusk.  Although a smaller town than
Soubar or Treil, it specializes less in farm goods and more in other
necessities that travelers along the eastern highway often demand.
The iron gates of Berdusk stand wide open, and look as if they've
never been closed.
52246.name: Road to Berdusk

description: You follow the small trail up the side of the mountain.  A steep
cliff lies on your north, and another deep ravine drops off to your
south.  Straight west is the only direction you can go, although the
going is difficult because of slippery rocks along the southern edge
of the trail.
52343.name: {*A Narrow Trail{x

description: This area isn't particularly interesting.  Rocks, scorpions,
snakes, lizards, and a few field mice pretty much tell the story of
this vast stretch of land.  The snakes in the area are very much the
color of the sand, and extremely hard to see unless you look
carefully.  Take care not to step on one, they could be poisonous.
52424.name: Eastern Highway

description: They are about a foot deep within the earth....
Several holes can be seen next to and around the side of the
highway.  They are about a foot deep and a couple feet across.  Its
impossible to say what could have dug them, but it looks as if someone
or something was searching for something.  Several large rocks are
also overturned, the black earth under them is exposed.
52435.name: Eastern Highway

description: The eastern gates of Tilverton look upon the western side of the
Thunder Peaks.  The roadway heads up into them and further into the
forests of the east.  The area outside of Tilverton is not
particularly well guarded, so it'd be best if you were careful.
52440.name: Eastern Gates of Tilverton

description: A few farmhouses stand together here, connected by a few narrow
dirt roads in what appears to be a small villa.  A couple children run
around, their parents looking on as they painstakingly plow the fields
nearby.  Your can distinctly smell animal sweat and feces.
52252.name: Eastern Highway

description: These boulders look as if they have been recently moved.  Freshly displaced earth shows where they fell.
The highway turns east and begins a steep ascent up the
mountainside.  Everything is completely silent and still, as if this
place stood motionless in time, interrupted only by your clumsy
intrusion.  Several more boulders, nearly as tall as you, lie in the
roadway.
52335.name: Nearing the Storm Horn Mountains

description: They stand quite a distance from you, distinctly aware of your presence.
Deer graze on grass a few hundred yards from the roadway, and
chipmunks scurry about collecting nuts.  Tracks and animal trails can
be seen not far from the surface of the highway.  Wildlife seems to be
plentiful.
52317.name: Eastern Highway

description: The roadway follows a wide path cleared in the wooded area of
trees.  The pine trees that surround the highway seem to be ancient,
very large, and very grotesque.  Branches twist about as they reach up
toward the sky, groping for light in the dense wood.  Only a short
distance can be seen past the first row of trees, they're so thick
that there's bearly any walking distance between them.
52443.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: Sharp rocks cover the ground all directions except down.
The trail becomes undiscernable here.  It appears to go off in
about 5 directions at once.  However, none of these are followable, as
they are cluttered with boulders and sharp shards of rocks.  Whomever,
or whatever uses this trail must not mind climbing over boulders or
walking on sharp rocks...
52348.name: {*A Narrow Trail{x

description: The lands and roadway remain unchanged.  You continue your climb
and decent over the hills of the area, and the road continues its path
weaving between trees, boulders, and large patches of thick brush.
52297.name: Eastern Highway

description: A large naturally formed rock ledge leads between two precipices
overhanging both faces of the cliffs.  The precipices are indented
just enough into the cliff faces that they might offer some protection
during a rainstorm, or from falling rocks from above.
52352.name: {*A Small Outcropping of Rock{x

description: The trail is even more overgrown here.  Grass and weeds grow in the
middle of the it, and tree limbs stretch over the pathway.  Rustling
in the dry needles that line the ground alert you to the presence of
some small animal, probably scampering away as it sensed your
presence.
52302.name: A Small Trail

description: An abundance of wildlife can be seen from the roadside.  Rabbits,
deer, birds, chipmunks, prairie dogs, and even a coyote or two can be
seen sneaking around at a safe distance from the highway.  Most of the
animals pay little attention to you, and go about whatever business
they have to tend to.
52480.name: Eastern Highway

description: Misty clouds surround the summit of the towering mountain to the
north.  It reminds you of an elderly man with a thin face of rock and
balding white hair atop his head staring at you.  The mountain,
although almost mournful, does not seem in the least bit unfriendly or
uninviting.  These mountains would be a wonderful place to go to get
away from the rest of world.  Not a creature or another living being
can be seen anywhere.
52446.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: To the far southeast the tip of some woods can be seen.  Several
white mares graze in pastures of healthy green grass seperated by
white picket fences a short ways away.  A small town lies directly
south of your position.
52207.name: The Eastern Highway

description: You continue on.  The river is on your west, the thining forest is
on your east.  High peaks of distant mountains can be seen rising far
off, over the treetops east of you.
52225.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The southern tip of the Reaching Woods lie a few hundred yards
south of you.  The forest is not extremely dense, and you can see a
ways past the edge of the first trees.  The road turns westward from
here, away from the forest and toward the open plains beyond.
52224.name: The Eastern Highway

description: As you climb upwards, you have the distinct feeling you are being
watched.  However, the rocks and cliffs around you are just as silent
and motionless as before.  Several unmarked paths zigzag away from the
highway, none of them followable.  It would probably be best to stay
on the marked path in front of you, there's no telling what ills could
await you if you became lost in these mountains.
52336.name: Nearing the Storm Horn Mountains

description: These are are the foothills that lead up to the mountains.  Some
brush grows in the area, but other than that, little vegigation can be
seen.  The air is cooler, and a damp earthy smell is present around
you.  The road bends east, turning directly into the nearest of the
Storm Horn Mountains.
52331.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road continues on uninterrupted.  Every so often, a group of
weary travelers can be seen resting on the side of the road.
Ocassionally a horse driven carriage quickly rushes past you, rudely
throwing dust and pebbles into your mouth.
52203.name: The Eastern Highway

description: King's forest is composed of many dark and twisted trees, growing so close together they are like fabric.
You stand atop a rather high hill.  The highway steeply descends
after this, giving you a good view of the lands to the east.  To the
north, a river runs from the mountain southward, intersecting with the
roadway some miles in the distance.  Open plains lie to east.  To the
south stands the dense and uninviting King's Forest, nestled on the
western cradle of the High Horns.
52400.name: Eastern Highway

description: The hills abruptly end as you leave the valley behind you.  The
mountains tower over you from the west, but to the north and east lie
endless open plains.  A few wooded areas surround the river to the
northeast of you, making it difficult see exactly where it runs.
52407.name: Eastern Highway

description: Below you to the east lies a several hundred foot drop.  Be
careful, the road has no fence or rail, one slip and you'd find
yourself falling into a chasm filled with rocks as sharp as razors
below.
52337.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: The eastern gates of Tilverton stand to the west of you, the
Thunder Peaks rise up to the north and south.  The road continues to
the east, up the ridge that runs inbetween the northern and southern
Thunder Peaks.  The area is heavily wooded, high pines form a dense
carpet of green inbetween the mountains.
52441.name: Approaching Tilverton

description: There seems to be quite a bit of forestland in this valley.
The Sunset Mountains quickly retreat northward here, away from you.
In fact, to the east they end altogether.  A fairly wide valley lies
between the eastern edge of the sunset mountains and the western edge
of the Storm Horn Mountains.  The town for Proskur lies at the foot of
that valley.
52319.name: Eastern Highway

description: The town of Treil lies to the south, a variety of activity can be
seen beyond its gates of iron bars.  Travellers of all sorts are
around you, using this road to get to or from Treil.  Several
horse-drawn carriages also skuttle down the middle of the broad road.
52235.name: Approaching the Town of Treil

description: The woodland from the north and south closes in about the road at
this juncture.  The plains lie behind you to the west, dense forest
lies ahead of you to the east.  Fortunately the road is neatly kept,
and not overgrown, even within the woods.  Warm green sunlight filters
down from the canopy leaves above your head.
52458.name: Eastern Highway

description: Each boulder must weight several tons, they would be impossible for anyone to budge.
Several tremendous boulders lie a few hundred yards away.  Its hard
to imagine how they ended up this far from the mountains.  Perhaps in
the ancient past an enourmous mudslide flung them from the side of the
mountain.  Or perhaps an overgrown giant tossed them here while in a
furious rage.
52286.name: Eastern Highway

description: Several small pine trees grow in the middle of the road here.
Although they don't entirely block your passage to the east, you can
just barely make out the continuation of the trail.  Nettle plants
grip your clothing as you walk past them, leaving tiny burrs inbedded
on all exposed cloth beneath your waist.
52303.name: A Small Trail

description: The Thunder peaks stretch north as far as the eye can see.
Fortunately the road you now travel does not head due north, but
rather curves east after some distance.  Overturned earth on your east
perhaps tells of a recent landslide.  The area looks muddy, as if much
rain has fallen in the last couple of days.
52470.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: You can only see a few yards in front of you due to the ziggzagging
of the valley and the trail that runs through it.  Every so often it
appears that the trail winds right up to a cliff and then ends, only
to suddenly turn to the right or left.  Occasionally you see a strange
looking dried substanced splattered on the rocks near the edge of the
trail.  It looks as if it could be blood, but its impossible to tell.
52351.name: {*A Narrow Trail{x

description: The scenery around you remains much the same as you continue to the
east.  Compared to the highway along the river, this stretch of land
is surprisingly bleak and undisturbed.  The land looks wild and
uninhabited, it would probably be best if you stayed on the roadway.
52277.name: Eastern Highway

description: The small valley twists and turns westward.  An outcropping of rock
lies overhead, making a kind of natural bridge halfway up the cliffs
that leads to nowhere.  Several boulders are positioned so that it
would not be extremely difficult to climb up to the outcropping.
52350.name: {*A Narrow Trail{x

description: The brushland continues as you head north along the highway.  A few
scraggily trees rise up from half dead vegitation in the area, choked
for water in this arid region.  Every once in awhile you pass a
streambed, all of which have dried up ages ago.
52285.name: Eastern Highway

description: A few mountains lie to your north, the extreme western rim of the
Storm Horn chain.  However, these are more modest mountains than the
others in the chain, and they appear to be much lower and much less
wide than the mountains west of Arabel.  Far to the east, a river can
be seen.  Beyond that, a thick forest runs up to the feet of the
Thunder Peaks, which can be seen far away to the northeast.
52411.name: Eastern Highway

description: They are arranged in an intricate pattern, and are a {rreddish {ybrown{x color.
As you come closer to Iriaebor, the dirt of the road you walk on
becomes paved with cobblestone.  The redish-brown stones are tightly
packed together.  The road also widens enough to let 3 or 4 carrages
to pass each other at the same time.
52273.name: Approaching the Town of Iriaebor

description: Once out of the hills, another flat area of farmland opens up
before you.  The road curves more sharply south here, away from the
hills northwest of you.  Several overturned carts lie by the side of
the road with broken axles, apparent fatalities of someone's long
jouney.  You can smell the stench of rotten fruit.
52205.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Watch it, you wouldn't want it to collapse on your head.
This small building appears to have been an inn in times far past,
but its long since been abandoned.  Only a few patches of white paint
remain, the rest has all peeled away.  Several parts of the roof have
