sagged in, leaving gigantic holes in the ceiling of the building.
Underneath the windowsills a variety of birds have made nests, taking
advantage of the natural shelter provided to them.
52306.name: The Wayward Inn

description: The road flattens out and becomes much wider to the east, probably
to allow carriages and other vehicles to travel along it.  A sign is
posted along the roadway here, pointing toward the east.  A Warm
easterly breeze brushes across your face.
52401.name: Eastern Highway

description: To the west you can see an excellent view of the western edge of
the Thunder Peaks.  The forest in which you now travel spans a
surprising distance to the west.  You can just barely make out its
edge.  The town of Tilverton can be seen beyond this, small and barely
recognizable.
52447.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: The sun having lost much of its glare, the area is much cooler now.
In fact, patches of regular soil can be seen.  Small trees and bushes
grow in the larger of these patches.  Apparently this vegitation can
stand the arid sandy soil, but not the intense heat.
52428.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road decends to a flood plain here.  You climb down sharply,
and the road narrows.  On the east of you lies a steep embankment with
the treeline of the forest a few hundred yards in the distance.  To
the west, only a few yards away the river rushes past you.  No grass
lies between the edge of the road and the river, only dried mud
covered with a variety of old animal tracks.
52219.name: The Eastern Highway

description: {ROUCH!{x Those thistles really hurt.
The road heads eastward away from the town of Iriaebor.  Thistle
and weeds line the side of the road as far as the eye can see.
Clearly this land is less kept than that west of Iriabor, and
obviously the road is much less traveled than the roads to the west.
A cold north breeze blows across your face.
52274.name: Eastern Highway

description: The trees far below sway, it must be quite windy.  Your completely
sheltered from the wind, however, as the high mountains are to your
east.  The roadway is wider here, and better kept than the roadway
through the southern portion of the Storm Horn Mountains.  A few vines
grow down the steep cliffs, but they'd offer little to grab on to if
one were to fall from where you now stand...
52377.name: {*A Mountain Road{x

description: They are mostly composed of oaks and elms.
You continue down the forest road, heading northeast.  Its
suprisingly cool underneath the trees for how brightly the sun is
shining overhead.  Much of the sunlight is not blocked by leaves and
illuminates your surroundings quite well.  A light breeze blows across
your face and rustles the leaves overhead.
52486.name: Eastern Highway

description: The town off in the distance is probably the mountain town of High Horn.
Mountains tower over you to the north and southeast.  The roadway
continues down a small valley between the northern and eastern
mountains into what appears to be a natural path for the highway.  Far
to the east you can make out a small town.  If you stare hard enough
you can make out whisps of smoke escaping from the tallest visable
chimneys.
52389.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: Vegitation is very thick on this open plain.  Lush green grass and
healthy bushes grow all around, some trees grow here and there too, a
few of them very large.  Animals of all sorts can be seen all around
you, and a multitude of insects can be heard, yet not seen, from the
roadside.
52453.name: Eastern Highway

description: Several more boulders go whizzing overhead, as if they were tiny
pebbles.  They seem to be coming from the west, where the trail your
on continues.  Are you sure you should be going this way?  It might be
a good idea if you don't meet up with whatever is doing this.
52341.name: {*A Small Trail{x

description: The mountains loom overhead now, as the road takes you directly
between the two southernmost mountains of the chain.  Ahead of you,
and as far as the eye can see, loom the slim twisted peaks of the
Storm Horns.  The sun is all but blotted out, and the area has an
unsettling darkness around it.
52334.name: Nearing the Storm Horn Mountains

description: Birds fly high overhead effortlessly.
Far overhead you can see the faint outline of a group of high
flying birds.  They glide silently above you, drifting on the strong
wind currents.  If only you had wings too, you could escape the task
of walking up and down the continuous steep hills and bluffs that the
eastern highway runs over.
52309.name: Eastern Highway

description: Ever since you left the banks of the River Reaching, the hills
throughout the land have become more pronounced.  The road takes you
over these hills as it weaves about the brushland.  At the tops of of
the larger of these hills, quite a distance can be seen.
52278.name: Eastern Highway

description: Cattails and thistle line the roadway, and animal tracks can be
seen next to the road.  On these hills lie a great deal of brush and
dead growth.  However, the road is neatly cleared from all debris.
Obviously someone has gone to a great deal of trouble to keep it clear
from weeds.
52204.name: The Eastern Highway

description: Uggggg.....it's {YHOT{x
As you continue on, the land becomes noticeably more arid.  The
only trees in sight line the banks of the river to your east,
concealing it from plain view.  Every once in awhile you notice a doe
at the edge of these trees, grazing on vegitation.
52258.name: Eastern Highway

description: The roadway turns to the north here.  Directly ahead of you lies
the peaks of the Sunset Mountains, which grow taller by the hour.  A
feeling of loneliness seems to eminate from their slopes as they
embrace you in a silent stare.  Besides the birds overhead, you
haven't seen a living creature in miles.
52310.name: Eastern Highway

description: Strong guards stand watch just to the west of the city gates of
Proskur.  Apparently this town has had many troubles with evil
creatures and shady characters sneaking into the town and causing
havok.  The walls around the town stand thick and strong, reinforced
by stone masonry.
52321.name: Western Gates of Proskur

description: An eagle flies overhead, probably searching out a place to nest
higher in the mountains.  The branches of the trees move about wildly
at times and stand stark still at others.  On a few occasions it even
seems as if they are motioning to you, waving you toward or away from
them.  Although odd, the trees don't seem malicious or menacing.
52445.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: You continue your endless climb up the mountainside.  The landscape
changes little.  There are still no trees, vegitation, or water.
There are no signs of life at all.  These mountains convey a lonely
isolated feeling, which seems to become more depressing every step you
take further.
52356.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: They are still a long way off, but their {Wsnow{x capped peaks look very inviting in this heat.
Rolling hills now dominate the landscape, a deviation from the
seemingly endless expanse of flat land behind you.  The tall mountains
to the northeast are more than just a blur now.  Their snow capped
peaks can be seen against the horrizon clearly as you get closer to
them.
52259.name: Eastern Highway

description: A {Gt{guft of {Gg{grass grows here, struggling to survive.
A boulder the size of a house sits to the north.  The roadway
weaves around this to the west, slanting downward a bit as it does
so.  This part of the mountain chain seems to get a bit more
precipitation than the southern rim, a few tufts of grass can be seen
growing within some of the cracks along the mountainside.
52361.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: The town of Tilverton is south of you, the monsterous Thunder Peaks
rise up over you to the north.  The road ahead takes you directly up
into the mountains, although over the lowest ones visable in the
chain.  The highway skirts some tall hills to the west that lead to a
more rugged part of the mountains.  Crags and cliffs can be seen on
the southwest side of the mountains to the north.
52442.name: Approaching Tilverton

description: Beyond the eastern gates of Iriaebor, the highway resumes its
endless march.  Although the traffic east of town is less than that
west of it, the roadway is still well traveled.  The road is rockier,
however, and carts have a harder time traveling over its surface.
52272.name: Eastern Gates of Iriaebor

description: High Horn stands on your west, the lights of the city give a cozy
feeling compared to the marked darkness around you as you stand in the
shadow of the mountains to the north.  Fortunately the highway leads
southeast, away from the northern High Horn Mountains.  From the
tracks in the dust of the highway, you can tell there is a large
volume of traffic on the eastern side of High Horn.
52388.name: Approaching the Town of High Horn

description: The grass is knee high, and the trail becomes unrecognizable.
However, the only direction you can go is north, where the trees
aren't quite so dense.  There appears to be a clearing several hundred
meters north of here, and perhaps the end of this rough path.
52304.name: A Small Trail

description: The hills become steeper.  Climbing up some of the larger ones can
be a tiresome task, as the road can be quite steep at times.  Small
valleys lie between the hills, and this is where most of the small
trees in the area can be found.
52294.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road continues off to the southeast.  In the distnace you can
just barely make out the beginings of the vast eastern seas on the
eastern horrizon.  To the south a sprawling landscape shows the
roadway continuing far off to the south, toward the towns that lie in
that direction.
52325.name: A Road

description: They look rather wild and uninviting.
The road continues eastward off into the distance.  The air has
become a bit more cool, and the sun seems not quite as hot as it was
before.  You can feel the land slope notibly upward now, and the
jagged mountains to the northeast draw closer along the horrizon.
52262.name: Eastern Highway

description: The sunset mountains look rather forboding from this view.
The sun dips behind thick clouds, which seem to be rolling off the
mountainside.  The peaks of the tallest of the Sunset Mountains are
obscured from view by them.  Although fairly ominous, the clouds
appear to contain no precipitation.  If it does start to rain, the
nearest tree would offer little protection.  Like most of the trees in
the area, it is little more than a large bush.
52298.name: Eastern Highway

description: It seems bottomless, its {*blackness{x very unsettling...
Three-hundred feet below lies the bottom of an incredible chasm.
The bottom is fairly dark, and you can't make out exactly what lies
there, other than the sparkle of a few objects as they catch a ray of
sunlight from overhead.
52362.name: {*An Overhang{x

description: Directly to the north, a thick line of evergreens extends to the
base of the northern mountains.  No manmade trails lead from the
highway into this dense forest, which appears to be almost impossible
to navigate through.  The tips of the trees to the north sway in the
breeze slightly, as if they were waving at you.
52318.name: Eastern Highway

description: An outpost stands here, filled with half a dozen heavily armed
guards.  Ocassionally the guards stop a stranger along the road,
asking him questions about where he's from or where he's going.  They
give you no trouble, however, and allow you to pass to the east
uninterrupted.  The iron wrought city gates stand wide open, they
appear not to have been closed in a very long time.
52409.name: Approaching Arabel

description: You stand on a grassy hill, covered with long grass that waves
violently in the strong wind.  The sun is very bright, and shines in
your eyes.  A few tall trees stand in the area, their branches
extending far overhead and offering some refreshing shade.  It looks
as if this area has never been inhabited.
52396.name: {GO{gn A H{Gillside{x

description: They are mostly composed of oaks and elms.
You hear the sound of running water to the east, yet the forest
obscures your view so that you can't see the source of the sound.  The
road declines a bit, heading down a hill in the forest.  A few more
thorn bushes grow off to the side of the road, inviting travelers to
get stuck on their thorns.
52488.name: Eastern Highway

description: Proskur lies directly to the east.  The town has only one western
entrance, the rest is surrounded by thick stone walls at least 15 feet
high.  Why would the town need such high walls surrounding it?
Several sentries stand on duty both atop the wall and at the gates,
armed with halberds.
52320.name: Approaching the Town of Proskur

description: Rolling plains open up before you, they stretch as far as the eye
can see.  The woods abruptly end on your east, and the road diverges
to the southeast here.  It follows the southwest edge of the woods.  A
sign stands at the interesection of the road on which you curently
follow and a road that branches from it.
52226.name: The Eastern Highway

description: The River Reaching flows quickly about 200 yards to your west.  At
this juncture it becomes a bit less wide, but a darker blue;
indicating that is becoming deeper.  Some recently plowed fields lie
to your east and west.  The overturned soil is black, suggesting that
this is superb farmland.
52251.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road follows a narrow mountain pass around the northeastern
side of the eastern thunder peaks.  The air is much colder here than
lower down the mountain, and combined with the breeze it can be quite
chilly.  No animals can be seen within the pine trees, but a few birds
can be heard singing from not too far away.
52474.name: The Thunder Peaks

description: Best if you just get away from the boulders overhead as quickly as possible...
A sign hangs here, posted on a small wooden stake.  Several small
boulders lie in the roadway, more are perched precariously overhead.
If one of those should fall, it would probably either split your head
open or bump you off the cliffside.
52378.name: {*A Mountain Road{x

description: A small human-made trail leads off the highway to the south here.
You can see that it has been recently traveled, several bootprints can
be seen in a patch of mud along this trail.  The main road continues
eastward.
52279.name: Eastern Highway

description: The southeastern fork of the highway takes a route that runs south
of Proskur.  This is the quickest way to reach the towns that lie
south of the Lake of Dragons without having to travel past Proskur.
Quite interesting characters use this roadway, and its impossible to
be bored with all the strange faces you see.
52283.name: A Road

description: A river can be seen to the south, flowing from the mountains to the
east southwest toward Arabel.  Beyond the river to the south you can
just make out the outline of a forest.  The highway itself continues
northeast, away from the river and toward the sunset mountains to the
west.
52425.name: Eastern Highway

description: As you enter the wood, darkness surrounds you.  Having just been in
bright sunlight, you suddenly feel blind.  Strange bird calls echo
throughout the forest, and you can hear the scuffling of animal noises
around you.  You notice a dim light ahead, piercing through the
darkness of the wood.
52241.name: Trail in the Reaching Woods

description: The two peaks glare down at you with the utmost distaste.
You continue deeper into the heart of the Storm Horn Mountains.
Two peaks rise stare down at you from the east, these are easily the
two tallest mountains you've been close to so far.  Perhaps if these
mountains had enough precipitation, they may even be snowcapped.  The
roadway leads north, away from the two tall mountains to the east.
52354.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: Peach trees stand here in rows, their branches drooping from the
loads of fruit that they carry.  Several ladders are pearched against
the sides of the trees, with half filled baskets of ripe peaches below
them.  The air is saturated with the smell of ripe fruit, and a
variety of bees and other insects buzz around your ears.
52495.name: A{Gn {xO{Grchard{x

description: Its really quite a beautiful view...
Its really quite a beautiful view...
You stand along a very high ridge.  In the south you can see the
peaks of the lower Storm Horn Mountains below you, stretching out.  To
the southwest you can see the Sunset Mountains rising up, dwarfing
even the highest of the Storm Horns.  Far to the southeast, you can
make out the glimmer of water along the horizon, probably the ocean or
a large sea in the distance.
52359.name: {*A Road Within the Storm Horn Mountains{x

description: Boulders of various shapes and sizes are strewn about.
It's a nice looking town, from this distance it looks cozy and peaceful.
A high spire of rock juts out of the ground directly to the east.
Several irregular shaped boulders lie at its foot.  To the south you
have a wonderful view of the sprawling town of Arabel, whisps of smoke
can be seen originating from the chimneys of the northern-most houses
in town.
52431.name: {*Within the Storm Horns{x

description: Some dead branches and tree stumps lie in a cluster here.  It looks
as if the wood was rotten and felled for some reason, perhaps during a
storm.  The bark is stripped away and some black mushrooms with yellow
spots grow upon the rotten wood.  Several fat white grubs can be seen
just underneath some of the dead limbs.
52460.name: A Forest Road

description: More well-armed guards stand east of the eastern gates of Proskur.
Several outposts can be seen in the distance, likely stationed with
guards to prevent creatures that might wander down from the mountains
getting too close to the town.
52322.name: Eastern Gates of Proskur

description: Several of the rocks here form what appears to be natural table
tops.  A few brownish lizards lie on these slabs of rock, heating
themselves in the sun.  The only movement you notice around you is a
large striped snake slowly making its way across the sandy soil.
52421.name: {*Within the Storm Horns{x

description: How did these things get here anyway?
The roadway becomes narrower here.  Several boulders lie in the
roadway, obviously recent additions to its surface.  But how, exactly,
did these boulders get here?  Perhaps they dislodged from the
mountains and bounced down here.  However, there doesn't seem to be
any sign of a place where they rolled down...
52332.name: Eastern Highway

description: Blacksmiths and several inns are along the main street in Berdusk.
A great variety of stores sell everything from traveling gear to
weapons intended for the most advanced of warriors.  If you want
something, you can probably find it in this town.
52247.name: Berdusk

description: The Starwater River runs from the northern mountains to the southwest
past the highway and through the forests to the south.  A sturdy plank
bridge spans across the river, which isn't particularly wide, but is
very fast moving.  The water is crystal clear, and seems to invite you
to take a drink.
52404.name: Crossing the Starwater River

description: There are several pillars of solid rock in this area, as if they
were bony fingers.  A few of these pillers stand broken off, their
tops mysteriously missing.  Perhaps some giant thought they'd make a
good toothpick...
52374.name: {*A Road Deep Within the Mountains{x

description: A pine forest stands to the north, dark green and very dense.
You stand at the top of a very large hill.  It is easy to see the
surrounding area and lands.  Far to the north lies a dense grove of
pine trees.  However, a few pines dot the lands before the forest, the
nearest being just a mile or two away.  Other than the mountains to
the north, the land looks virtually the same all directions from the
point at which you now stand.
52296.name: Eastern Highway

description: More huge boulders lie on either side of the road.  How did these things get here anyway?
No new sights or sounds greet your eyes, just the continuation of
the same bleak landscape as far as the eye can see.  The surface of
the road winds to the northeast, weaving around brush patches and
boulders that have remained unmoved for eons.
52291.name: Eastern Highway

description: This road heads south of Proskur, away from the eastern highway
that leads into the Storm Horn Mountains.  Far to the east lies the
body of water named the Lake of Dragons, south of this lies half a
dozen moderate to large-sized towns that have thrived off of the trade
from the waterways of the east.
52323.name: A Road

description: The city walls of Proskur look tall and reinforced.
It's about 20 miles away to the east.
You stand atop a very tall bluff.  Directly to the north the Sunset
Mountains stare at you with a blank face.  However, the Sunset
Mountains end in the far distance to the northeast.  To the east of
them lie the Storm Horn Mountains.  Nestled between the two mountain
chains lies the town of Proskur.  The tall walls of the city,
undoubtably erected to keep beasts from the mountains out of the town,
can clearly be seen from where you stand.
52328.name: Eastern Highway

description: The mountains are silent and unchanging.  The sweltering sun beats
down on the rocks of the High Horns, which absorb and multiply its
reflected heat at you.  No breeze at all blows within the mountains,
as they make a perfect windblock around you.  Fortunately the mountain
chain is extremely narrow here, you can already make out the end of
this mountainous region to the northeast.
52420.name: {*Within the Storm Horns{x

description: Cliffs rise up to your east and west, completely obscuring the view
of Proskur and its surrounding forests.  The only paths to take are
north into the mountains, or back southwest the way you came.  No
trees, grass, or bushes grow anywhere in sight.  In fact, the
mountains seem to be completely devoid of all life.
52333.name: Eastern Highway

description: The land climbs steadily upwards.  Unlike the Storm Horn Mountains,
the Thunder Peaks are a string of tall individual mountains.  From
where you stand you can see very few cliffs or cravasses, the
foothills run up to the mountain forests which slope steeply upward
until the treeline clears on each of the mountains.  You can now tell
that there is quite a distance inbetween the towering Thunder Peaks.
52436.name: Eastern Highway

description: The road that leads south of Arabel is packed with traders that
constantly travel between Arabel and the port city of Suzail.  Goods
brought to this part of the land on the high seas are often brought
over this road into Arabel and shipped off to other parts of the
realms that demand such wares.
52414.name: Southern Gates of Arabel

description: Birds chirp from the treetops overhead happily, a constant noise in
the otherwise quiet forest.  The trees that make up the canopy above
you are mostly huge ancient oaks.  Some of their trunks are nearly
five feet across with branches that span over the highway.  Their
leaves are a deep healthy green.
52459.name: A Forest Road

description: Further to the northeast stands more trees, and a lightly forested
region.  The road you travel takes you on the southern outskirts of
this area, away from the arid regions to the south and southwest of
where you now stand.  A few cottages and cabins can be seen
interspersed in these light woods; the first sign of human life you've
seen in quite a ways.
52312.name: Eastern Highway

description: The sparkle of several brilliant quartz stones catches your eye.
The whitish colored rocks glint from the sides of boulders and from
the outcropping of rocks that line the cliffs around you.  No lose
stones lie near the side of the road, though, so you must be content
to examine them from a distance.
52419.name: {*Within the Storm Horns{x

description:
An extremely tall giant towers over you, happily grinning as he
whirls huge boulders over your head.  It looks as if he could smash
you flat just by stepping on you.  Buldging muscles can be seen
underneath his tattered clothing.  Although he looks very strong, he
also appears to be very stupid.  Perhaps if you just leave him alone
you can sneak away undetected.
52250.room_name: A {BSt{bo{yrm {YGi{ban{Bt{x stands here with a stupid grin on his face.
52250.name: a storm giant~

description:
He carries a big club and looks rather unhappy, even for a troll. 
This dimwitted creature inhabits areas of the Storm Horn Mountains. 
Although it isn't usually able to outwit its pray, it can usually
overpower it with brute strength.
52251.name: a moutain troll~

description:
A goblin stands here dressed in a few tattered rags.  He is armed
with a crudely made, but very sharp spear which he grips with both
hands very tightly.
52252.room_name: A fierce little goblin eyes you cautiously.
52252.name: a fierce goblin~

description:
This little bird flies to and fro rather quickly, gathering
materials for its nest on the steep cliffside.
52253.room_name: A bird flies along the cliffside here.
52253.name: a small bird~

description:
This townsperson idley walks across the road, trying to find
something interesting to do.
52254.room_name: A citizen of Soubar stands here, trying to look busy.
52254.name: a townsperson~
subroutines:
F for AHM
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
A traveler walks along the roadway briskly, heading toward some
unknown destination.
52255.room_name: A traveler walks along the roadway.
52255.name: a traveler~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCEFGHIJK

description:
Dressed in overhalls and carrying a big basket of ripe fruit, this
farmer is probably headed to a nearby town to sell his produce.
52256.room_name: A farmer carrying a basket of fruit walks besides you.
52256.name: a farmer~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

52257.d_flags: D Says 'How dare you pick on the elderly!'~
description:
This old geezer looks like he's already half dead.  He stumbles
along as a snail's pace and carries a walking stick which he uses to
support most of his weight.
52257.room_name: An old man carrying a twisted walking stick limps along here.
52257.name: an old man~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He's about 40 years old, greying hair, and has a short beard that
is well trimmed.  His hands are caked with dirt and he has a couple
gardening tools protruding from his pockets.
52258.room_name: A farmer with a wide brimmed hat is going for a stroll.
52258.name: a farmer~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description: He seems to be in a hurry and walks past you without saying a word.
52259.room_name: A townsperson travels along the roadway.
52259.name: a townsperson~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This shady character looks you over carefully though the corner of
his eye.  He wears a black hood which covers most of his face.
52260.room_name: A suspicious looking fellow eyes you carefully as you pass him.
52260.name: a traveler~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This huge crow looks as if its going to peck your eyes out.  Just
what made it so angry anyway?
52261.room_name: A {*black{x crow caws at you here.
52261.name: a black crow~

description:
This character doesn't even notice you as he passes you on the
roadside.
52262.room_name: A Treil townsperson walks past you.
52262.name: a treil townsperson~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
A very happy child runs around feasting on the excitement caused by
fresh produce being sold.
52263.room_name: A little boy runs around barefoot.
52263.name: a little boy~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This person is mulling over what fresh produce to buy.  It all
looks good, but there are so many choices.  MmmmMMmmmMMM....
52264.room_name: A customer stands here trying to decide what to purchase.
52264.name: a townsperson~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
A hardworking man, Ted runs his booth when he's not busy farming. 
He has a well-trimmed beard, and extremely hairy arms.  The fruit he
sells is carefully picked and washed, and extremely tasty, but not
cheap.  You get what you pay for.
52265.room_name: Farmer Ted stands here, haggling with customers.
52265.name: farmer ted~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This battle toughened thief patrols the eastern highway in search
of poeple to rob, hopefully he won't pick you next.  He wears a black
scarf and long gray cloak covered with dust.
52266.room_name: A roadside bandit stands here, deciding who to rob next.
52266.name: a roadside bandit~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par BCFGHIJK

description:
Although still just a common thief, this guy has seen quite a bit
of fighting.  His arms and face are covered with battle scars.  Large
muscles buldge out from his arms and legs.
52267.room_name: A strong bandit stands here, flexing his muscles.
52267.name: a strong bandit~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
Oliver is the boss of the bandits in this area.  He stands here
counting the jewels and other rare items that his followers bring him
from their thievery and robbings.  Oliver carries with him a sword
that he acquired from a particularly fruitful robbery of a wealthy
merchant.  He also wears some expensive looking chainmail, and a
colorful hat mounted with a peacock feather.
52268.room_name: Oliver, boss of the bandits stands here counting his loot.
52268.name: Oliver~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
M exall 52200 0~

description:
This fellow wears a green traveler's cape and high black boots that
are coated with the fine dust of the roadway.  In his right hand he
carries a small burlap sack.
52269.room_name: A traveler carrying a sack walks past you.
52269.name: a traveler~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

52270.d_flags: D Screams How dare you kill me before I finish my quest!~
description:
Clad in white armor and carrying a broadsword, this knight searches
for a way to complete his quest.  He carries his helmet under his arm
and gives you a slight nod as you pass him.
52270.room_name: A Paladin on a quest travels here.
52270.name: a paladin~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He's not sure exactly how he got way out here, but he's completely
lost.  If your feeling nice you could stop and perhaps give him
directions?
52271.room_name: A traveler wanders around here looking lost.
52271.name: a traveler~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
With a spade in hand, this farmer travels down the roadway
finishing up his farmwork.  His hands, face, and clothes are
completely covered with dirt and mud.
52272.room_name: A farmer covered with dirt head to toe stands here.
52272.name: a farmer~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This person's hands are stained purple from working all day with
the grapes in the vinyards.  His hair is a mangled mess and he doesn't
look all that well groomed.  Is this really the type of person you
want to be involved with making wine?
52273.room_name: A vinyard worker crosses the road.
52273.name: a vinyard worker~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
Ah to be young again...  This carefree lad hops to and fro with a
giant smile on his face.  He and the other children of the area have a
great deal of fun playing, oblivious to their parents' hard work.
52274.room_name: A child runs around here playing.
52274.name: a child~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He's pretty old with greying hair and wrinkled skin.  He doesn't
look very happy as he tries to avoid stepping on the children that run
back and forth.
52275.room_name: A farmer walks across the road, dodging the children in his path.
52275.name: a farmer~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

52276.d_flags: D Says I never even got to sell my crops you bastard!~
description:
He grunts and groans as he heaves his heavy sac across his
shoulders.  Hopefully he doesn't have far to walk, otherwise he might
not make it.
52276.room_name: A farmer walks along carrying a heavy sac of vegetables in his arms.
52276.name: a farmer~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He's very patient and doesn't pay attention to you.  It's a nice
plump squirrel he's really after.
52277.room_name: A tomcat waits here silently, ready to pounce on a squirrel.
52277.name: a tomcat~
subroutines: F off FH

description:
He runs around collecting acorns.  He doesn't seem concerned about
much, and he's pretty fat for a squirrel.
52278.room_name: A squirrel hops about collection acorns.
52278.name: A squirrel~
subroutines: F par J

description:
He wears a wide brimmed hat to keep the sun out of his eyes, and a
lose cotten cloak.  Several pouches and sacks are attached to his
belt, and they jingle as he walks along.
52279.room_name: A traveler with a wide brimmed hat walks along.
52279.name: a traveler~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This fellow has long since sold out of all his stock of goods. 
Without anything to sell, he has no choice but to go back and restock.
52280.room_name: A merchant out of wares passes you by.
52280.name: a merchant~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He carries a large doubled-edged battle axe by his side and wears a
suit of dwarvish platemail.  His long read beard would almost touch
the ground, but it's neatly tucked into his belt.  He seems rather
unhappy and glares at you while you look at him.
52281.room_name: A grumpy dwarf mutters something as he walks past you.
52281.name: a dwarf~

52282.d_flags: D Says Don't forget to check out Iriaebor!~
description:
He smiles at you and invites you to visit his town of Iriaebor.  He
suggests that you stay at the many comfortable inns they offer in town
for rest and relaxation.
52282.room_name: A villager of Iriaebor stands here, greeting potential visitors.
52282.name: a townsperson~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

52283.d_flags: D Says I'm not afraid to die!~
description:
This old woman looks a little...  Odd.  She seems a bit too happy,
and it almost looks as if she intends to give you a hug.  Best hurry
along before she follows through with her intentions.
52283.room_name: An old woman stands here giving you a toothy grin.
52283.name: An old woman~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

52284.d_flags: D Says I'm gonna come back and haunt you.~
description:
This traveler wears heavy platemail and carries several heavy
swords by his side.  It's no wonder he's tired out from walking after
carrying that much weight.  He also wears a tan leather hat and black
leather boots.
52284.room_name: A tired traveler sits here resting.
52284.name: a traveler~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He's just an average person from Iriaebor, but he flashes a smile
at you as you pass him.
52285.room_name: An Iriaebor townsperson walks along the roadway here.
52285.name: a townsperson~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This rabbit is tanish in color, and actually pretty cute.  Its
careful not to get too near to you though...
52286.name: a jackrabbit~

52287.d_flags: D Says A fight well fought!~
description:
This battle-hardened warrior has seen many great battles, but he
searches for even more.  We wears well crafted and tightly fitted
chainmail, and carries a huge broadsword.  A proud and almost arrogant
look covers his face.
52287.room_name: A strong warrior stands here, holding a broadsword.
52287.name: a strong warrior~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
This battle toughened thief patrols the eastern highway in
search;of poeple to rob, hopefully he won't pick you next.  He wears a
black;scarf and long gray cloak covered with dust.
52288.room_name: A roadside bandit stands here, deciding who to rob next.
52288.name: a roadside bandit~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par BCFGHIJK
M exall 52201 1~

description:
He doesn't seem particularly afraid of you, but he still watches
you carefully from a safe distance.  His fir is a glossy blackish
color, and he's rather plump.
52289.name: a racoon~
subroutines: F par V

52290.d_flags: D Says What did I ever do to you?~
description:
The green cloak he wears is obviously too long for him, and he has
to make a special effort just to keep himself from tripping over it as
he walks along.
52290.room_name: A traveler wearing a long green cloak walks along.
52290.name: a traveler~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
She appears to be very angry with the man she's with.  Are they
married?  Probably best not to ask...
52291.room_name: A woman sits here screaming her lungs out.
52291.name: a woman~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He appears to be very angry with the the woman he's with.  Are they
married?  Perhaps best not to ask...
52292.room_name: A man stands here yelling out obscenities.
52292.name: a man~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

52293.d_flags: D Says you may have slain me, but I was the fastest there ever was!~
description:
Lightning jack is known all throughout this area as the quickest
sprinter around.  He's actually pretty scrawny.  He has jet black
hair, and is very well groomed.  He wears a light vest of chainmail,
and a pair of very soft but durable boots.
52293.room_name: A traveler sits here looking rather content with his abilities.
52293.name: lightning jack~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

52294.d_flags: D Whinnies at you with disconent.~
description:
Lightning Jack's faithful steed, Swiftfoot stands here in all his
glory.  He gracefully chews on the grass of the area and looks very
content to be beside his master.
52294.room_name: A horse dubbed swiftfoot stands here grazing on grass.
52294.name: swiftfoot~
subroutines: F par GHIK

description:
This poor fellow has been banished from his home for some reason or
another.  He now wanders the area scavaging for food and begging for
change.
52295.name: an outcast~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
Townsfolk from the area use the eastern roadways to travel from
villa to villa or other small towns.  Most seem to know exactly where
they're headed.
52296.name: a townsperson~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

description:
He looks to be about 50 years old, he wears an old tattered cloak
some lose pants held up by cowhide belt.  He mutters something
indiscernible as you past him.
52297.room_name: A traveler with a long grey beard walks along.
52297.name: A traveler~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

52298.d_flags: D Says How dare you pick on us little people!~
description:
He's obviously doesn't know his way around because he's not really
walking in any direction.  He looks a bit scared, but he doesn't say a
word.  The little halfing wears no shoes, but a jacket which is far
too big for him.
52298.room_name: A halfling looks a little lost.
52298.name: a halfling~

description:
This furry critter runs around collecting nuts to store for the
winter months.
52299.room_name: A chipmunk runs around here, collecting nuts.
52299.name: a chipmunk~

52300.d_flags: D Shudders slightly as he collapses onto the floor.~
description:
A knight of pure darkness stands here, rejoicing in the ways of
evil.  His face is covered by a polished steel visor, and he wears
armor that radiates a dark magic.  Trained by an ancient order of evil
warriors, he lusts for nothing more than to cause hurt and misery to
all around him.
52300.room_name: A {*Dark {wK{*night{x stands here looking for weak things to kill or maim.
52300.name: {*Dark {wK{*night{x~
subroutines:
